attachments.title: Tutorial to Automa: Part 1 | BioJulia
attachments.text: Find this notebook at <https://github.com/jakobnissen/automa_tutorial> In bioinformatics, we have a saying: The first step of any bioinformatics project is to define a new file format, incompatible with all previous ones. The situation might not be quite as bad as the saying implies, but it is true that we have a lot of different file formats, representing the various kinds of data we work with. For that reason, creating file parsers is a central task in bioinformatics, and has almost become a craft in itself.
attachments.fallback: BioJulia: Tutorial to Automa: Part 1 | BioJulia
